info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:58AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE... NORTHEASTERN MONONGALIA AND NORTHEASTERN PRESTON COUNTIES THROUGH 945 AM EDT... At 857 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Point Marion, or 10 miles south of Uniontown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Fairchance, Markleysburg, Brandonville, Chalkhill, Bruceton Mills, Ohiopyle, Laurel Run, Hazelton, and Clifton Mills. This includes Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 18 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
